unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Probability: Mutually Exclusive and Independent Events
question_text: Classic Colonials has made a bid to build two houses.  Don, the owner of the company,  anticipates that the probability Classic Colonials wins the bid on the first house (event F ) is $0.95$ . the probability Classic Colonials wins the bid on the second house (event S ) is $0.90$ the probability Classic Colonials wins the bid on both houses (event( F and S )) is $0.90$ If Donâ€™s probabilities are correct, which of the following statements must be true about events F and S .

choices.text: Event F and  event S are not mutually exclusive and are  independent.
Event F and  event S are not mutually exclusive and are not independent.
Event F and  event S are mutually exclusive and are not independent.
Event F and  event S are mutually exclusive and are  independent.
Mutually exclusive and independence of events F and S cannot be determined with the information given.
